children.test: test should be a macro that eventually yields a set of test-container objects. It should inherit any context from its parent so that they can be nested.
children.it: it wraps a description and a set of statements to be executed. It inherits context from its parent test. It is not intended to be nested.
children.mocks: Mocks can be stored in a buffer generated by test. A function can be observed by wrapping it or fully replaced by hijacking the symbol.
